title: How to Recover Deleted Voicemail Messages on Android

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. This will typically be on the home row at the bottom of your screen. Check your app drawer if it is not there.

steps.title: Call the number for your voicemail system.
steps.content: Call the number for your voicemail system. This number will vary based on your provider. Call *86 on Verizon Wireless or U.S. Cellular. Press and hold 1 if you are on AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Cellular One, or Metro PCS.

steps.title: Enter your voicemail password if prompted.
steps.content: Enter your voicemail password if prompted. You may need to contact your service provider if you can't remember the password.

steps.title: Listen to your new or saved voicemails.
steps.content: Listen to your new or saved voicemails. New messages will usually play automatically, or you can press 1 to listen to your saved messages.

steps.title: Press 1 on the Message Playback menu.
steps.content: Press 1 on the Message Playback menu.

steps.title: Press 9 to save the message to your voicemail box.
steps.content: Press 9 to save the message to your voicemail box. [1] X Research source If you already hung up, the only way to recover a voicemail is through third-party programs.

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. This will typically be on the home row at the bottom of your screen. Check your app drawer if it is not there.

steps.title: Tap on Voicemail.
steps.content: Tap on Voicemail . This should be on the bottom left-hand corner of the screen. Some devices will have Voicemail as its own app. If this is the case, then check your app drawer for Voicemail .

steps.title: Tap on a voicemail from the list.
steps.content: Tap on a voicemail from the list.

steps.title: Tap on the delete button.
steps.content: Tap on the delete button. This will delete the voicemail.

steps.title: Tap on Undo on the pop-up screen at the bottom.
steps.content: Tap on Undo on the pop-up screen at the bottom. You will only have a few seconds to do this, so you will need to quickly tap on Undo . Once the pop-up screen disappears, there is no way to recover your voicemail without the use of third-party programs. Your device may also list this option as Undelete . [2] X Research source
